channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15360] Fix flaky TestSimpleRpcScheduler
item.description: There were several flaky tests added there as part of HBASE-15306 and likely HBASE-15136.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Sorry for the delay here, I likely will need to rewrite some waits on this test, hope to get it out tomorrow.
Thanks Mikhail Antonov
Ok I disable this for now Mikhail Antonov? Its a small test so we are not running medium and large when it fails.
Yeah let's disable this one for now, I'll get back to it as soon as I have time.

I think the problem is testSoftAndHardQueueLimits.

Add this can make it fail consistently


  @Test

  public void testSoftAndHardQueueLimits100() throws Exception {

    for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {

      testSoftAndHardQueueLimits();

    }

  }

The fix is that we should wait until the calls in queue have been consumed.

Lets commit. Our tests are in a sorry state while this is failing and preventing the run of later tests. Why non interruptible wait? Can we just do a plain wait? Otherwise, +1.. I'll commit myself with interruptible wait if you don't get to it Duo Zhang Thanks.

I just follow the sleep pattern in this testcase.

And please commit it stack. I'm already on the bed and using a mobile phone to type these words...

I'm already on the bed and using a mobile phone to type these words...

Smile. Will do. Thanks Duo Zhang
Pushed to branch-1.3+. Leaving open to see if it fixes build at apache. Thanks for the patch Duo Zhang
Thanks Duo Zhang and stack! Sorry again I haven't gotten to fixing this test earlier. Belated +1. Hope it clears the test failures on this test.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-1.4 #22 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.4/22/)

Let's open a new issue for this? Ted Yu
The patch uploaded here is a fix for testSoftAndHardQueueLimits.
The failed test was introduced by HBASE-15136 which was mentioned in the description of the JIRA.

Use EnvironmentEdge to get a stable result.
And also fix a typo in the constructor of SimpleRpcScheduler.
